intro: Sida edmondii, commonly known as Edmond's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its fibrous stems and hairy foliage are characteristic of the Malvaceae family. Sida edmondii is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
